stanza.line: Shall I compare thee to a summerday
Thou art more lovely and more temperate
Rough winds do shake the darling buds ofmay
And summer lease hath all too short a date
Sometime too hot the eye of heavenshines
And often is his gold complexion dimmed
And every fair from fair sometimedeclines
By chance or nature changing course untrimmed
But thy eternal summer shall notfade
Nor lose possession of that fair thouow
Nor shall death brag thou wandrest in hisshade
When in eternal lines to time thougrow
So long as men can breathe or eyes cansee
So long lives this and this gives life tothee
